cont.entity_a: Not sharp enough to be called a knife.
cont.entity_b: Requires additional force to chop effectively.

cont.entity_a: Flat blade makes it difficult to pick things up, and the handle is too plump and hard to hold.
Metal version may scratch counters, while plastic lacks flexibility.
cont.entity_b: Plastic tray may shear off into food.

cont.entity_a: Built to last a lifetime, sturdy, and heat resistant.
Versatile tool for cutting dough, scraping, and transferring ingredients.
Sharp edge, useful for cutting dough, but not for chopping herbs.
cont.entity_b: Works well for small items like garlic and chilis.

cont.entity_a: Useful measurement markings on the blade.

cont.entity_b: Difficult to clean as food gets stuck in the blades.

cont.entity_a: Great for chopping small veggies and transferring to pots.
cont.entity_b: Good for soft foods, not for hard vegetables.

cont.entity_a: Sharp corners can cause cuts; consider rounding them for safety.

cont.entity_b: Small capacity and struggles with hard vegetables.
Customer service and warranty service are excellent.
